VARDESC: When my child is in pain, I worry all the time about whether the pain will end.
When my child is in pain, I feel I can’t go on like this much longer.
When my child is in pain, it’s terrible and I think it’s never going to get better.
When my child is in pain, it’s awful and I feel that it overwhelms me.
When my child is in pain, I can’t stand it anymore.
When my child is in pain, I become afraid that the pain will get worse.
When my child is in pain, I keep thinking of other painful events.
When my child is in pain, I want the pain to go away.
When my child is in pain, I can’t keep it out of my mind.
When my child is in pain, I keep thinking about how much he/she is suffering.
When my child is in pain, I keep thinking about how much I want the pain to stop.
When my child is in pain, there is nothing I can do to stop the pain.
When my child is in pain, I wonder whether something serious may happen.
